Good game for a bit, but only has 1 game mode and very few free characters to play as. You need to spend a lot of money if you want the DLC characters, which are basically required unless you want to play the same 5 characters over and over.

You need to upgrade the characters to level 20 to be able to use them properly, and that takes a while. If you want to use one guys perks on another character, you need to be level 50 on that person, which is really long. Now this wouldnt be so bad but there are more than 50 people in the roster! 

Grindy game, too much DLC, only 1 gamemode. 4/10, gets boring fast

我得倾诉一下我的遭遇，本人双边玩家主玩人类，300个小时第一次上红二4颗星。本来要对红一发起冲击了，结果下一次打开游戏的时候给我来了一个虚拟引擎崩溃一下掉了两颗星。我平复一下心情后又开了一把结果又崩溃了，4颗星一口气给我扣完。之后过了一个星期，我TM又回到4颗星位置，先是碰见一个带静止隐身的守尸巴布，我在溜了4台后直接给他守死，完了他还点头嘲讽。游戏结束，掉一颗星，下一把一个小学护士，救3次人2次保护摸好2个开2台机，终局溜鬼2分钟极限走地道，最后看面板才加了一颗星，人直接傻了。但又回到了4颗星的我调整好心态带上满配医疗箱，来到了寒风农场，结果又给我卡出来了。我就想问问是不是人类的红一有名额限制，这最后一星难的和取经一样，我其他时候基本没闪退过，然后游戏故障就给我集中到这一会，我自认为也是个素质玩家，没想到被这么一款游戏整的想爆粗口，真是绝了。

Alive by Sundown is a solid 8.5/10 game. Though I do enjoy the overall gameplay, objectives, and goal for both survivor and killer, I do think it lacks a severe variety of specific technicalities and mechanisms of the game. For instance, most every single reaction between killer and survivor is either a skill check, or a simple "hold a button" kind of deal. Though there can be some traps set here and there, each gen is repaired in the same way, which gets repetitive and boring. 

It would be awesome to see a little more character and flair to specific events. Take Pinhead's puzzle for example, perhaps a short little quick and easy puzzle for survivors to solve, like the water pipe a-->b kind of puzzle or like, idk, a word search, instead of just doing harder skill checks. Or Literally anything to spice up the game a little more. 

Otherwise, like I said, solid game. Def recommend Alive by Sundown to all :))

Definitely one of my favorite games. It has massive potential. But I can't recommend it in its current state. It's a buggy mess and the current meta is super unfair and imbalanced. I wish the developers played their game and/or listened to the community.

This game is inescapable. Every day I want to quit. Every patch that nerfs the things I love and buffs the most annoying things in the game, I want to be done. Every time the devs show how out of touch they are with the community, I say I'm gonna walk away. But I don't. I just keep playing. I just keep spending money even after saying I don't want to support them. As the grind wears down on me I just keep playing with my non-meta builds. Even after better games come out and create another option, I'll likely still be rotting in the basement of DBD.

It's just fun. In spite of everything, the game is satisfying on a fundamental level. Each match is low enough commitment that even if it goes badly I can just move on. The funny ways players interact with each other even without any text or voice is consistently hilarious. There is enough variety that every match is different. Taking down an over-confident survivor, or looping a killer long enough to embarrass them, these never fail to put a smile on my face.

I almost wouldn't recommend this game. But I will. Just be prepared for toxicity, an unacceptably heavy grind, the need to spend extra money to get your favorite characters or build, and endlessly frustrating dev interactions. I can't say it will be worth it, but it will be fun. Join me. The water's... fine.

(And get BBQ and Chili! I regret not unlocking The Cannibal for it earlier. The grind is bad enough even with that perk doubling your income.)
